overview_of_class: Chemistry 210-2 is the second course in a three-term sequence in organic chemistry. It covers the chemistry of the major oxygen- and nitrogen-containing functional groups, as well as the chemistry of aromatic compounds. Mechanism is emphasized in the study of these materials. This course requires co-registration in the Chem 230-2, a laboratory course which includes an introduction to basic organic laboratory techniques, as well as the preparation, purification and characterization of organic substances.
name: Organic Chemistry
title: WCAS CHEM 210-2-23 Organic Chemistry
enrl_requirement:
Enrollment Requirements: Co-Requisite: Students must also register for Chemistry 230-2.
Add both classes to the shopping cart and submit together for successful registration.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Chemistry 210-2 is the second course in a three-term sequence in organic chemistry. It covers the chemistry of the major oxygen- and nitrogen-containing functional groups, as well as the chemistry of aromatic compounds. Mechanism is emphasized in the study of these materials. This course requires co-registration in the Chem 230-2, a laboratory course which includes an introduction to basic organic laboratory techniques, as well as the preparation, purification and characterization of organic substances.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Prerequisite: Grade of C- or better in Chemistry 210-1.

Students enrolled in this course MUST also enroll in the associated laboratory course, Chem 230-2.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
1. Organic Chemistry, 8th Edition, by L.G. Wade, Pearson ($144.20 new, looseleaf)***

2. Turning Technologies Response Card Model QT or NXT ("Clicker") and associated 1 year license ($55.00 new; $44 used)***

***Prices as listed by the Northwestern Norris Bookstore (4/4/17). Course materials may be available from other vendors at lower price.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
1. Solutions for Organic Chemistry, 8th Edition, Jan Simek, Pearson ($236.15 new; $177.10 used)***

2. Molecular Modeling Kit ($41.15 new; $30.85 used)***

***Prices as listed by the Northwestern Norris Bookstore (4/4/17). Course materials may be available from other vendors at lower price.
